title: Gapminder Analysis Home
text:
The Gapminder dataset contains information on life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for 142 countries from 1952 to 2007.

Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
Life Expectancy and Population

title: Gapminder Analysis Home
text:
The Gapminder dataset contains information on life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for 142 countries from 1952 to 2007.

Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
Life Expectancy and Population
Country Analysis

title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \
0  Afghanistan      Asia  1952           28.801             8.425333   
1  Afghanistan      Asia  1957           30.332             9.240934   
2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083   

   gdp_per_capita  
0      779.445314  
1      820.853030  
2      853.100710

title: Analysis of a Specific Country Over Time
text:
Below, we analyze changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for a specific country. Select the your country and metric of interest.

import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px

df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")
available_countries = df["country"].unique()  
metrics = {
    "Life Expectancy": "life_expectancy",
    "GDP per Capita": "gdp_per_capita",
    "Population": "population_millions",
}
default_country = "Brazil"
default_metric = "Population"

fig = px.line(
    df[df["country"] == default_country],
    x="year",
    y=metrics[default_metric],
    title=f"{default_metric} Trends in {default_country}",
    labels={"year": "Year", metrics[default_metric]: default_metric},
)

country_buttons = [
    {
        "args": [
            {"y": [df[df["country"] == c][metrics[default_metric]].values]},
            {"title": f"{default_metric} Trends in {c}"}
        ],
        "label": c,
        "method": "update",
    }
    for c in available_countries
]

metric_buttons = [
    {
        "args": [
            {"y": [df[df["country"] == default_country][metrics[m]].values]},
            {"title": f"{m} Trends in {default_country}"}
        ],
        "label": m,
        "method": "update",
    }
    for m in metrics.keys()
]

fig.update_layout(
    updatemenus=[
        {
            "buttons": country_buttons,
            "direction": "down",
            "x": 0.00,  
            "xanchor": "left",
            "y": 1.5,  
            "showactive": True,
            "font": {"size": 14},
            "active": list(available_countries).index(default_country), 
        },
        {
            "buttons": metric_buttons,
            "direction": "down",
            "x": 0.3,  
            "xanchor": "left",
            "y": 1.5,  
            "showactive": True,
            "font": {"size": 14},
            "active": list(metrics.keys()).index(default_metric),  
        },
    ]
)
fig.update_layout(
    xaxis_title="Year",
    yaxis_title=default_metric,
    font=dict(size=14),
    width=900,
    height=500,
)

fig.show()

title: Country Analysis
text:
Below, we analyze changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for a specific country (e.g., Japan).

import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px

df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Filter for one country, e.g., Japan
country_name = "Japan"
df_country = df[df["country"] == country_name]

# Line chart with multiple measures
fig = px.line(
    df_country.melt(id_vars=["year"], value_vars=["life_expectancy", "gdp_per_capita", "population_millions"]),
    x="year", 
    y="value", 
    color="variable",
    title=f"Changes in Japan's Indicators Over Time"
)
fig.show()

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
In this section, we analyze how life expectancy correlates with GDP per capita across years and continents.

import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px

df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

fig = px.scatter(
    df, 
    x="gdp_per_capita", 
    y="life_expectancy", 
    animation_frame="year", 
    color="continent",
    hover_name="country",
    size="population_millions",
    range_x=[100, 60000], 
    range_y=[20, 100],
    title="Life Expectancy vs. GDP Per Capita"
)

fig.show()

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
In this section, we analyze how life expectancy correlates with GDP per capita across years and continents.

import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px

df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

fig = px.scatter(
    df, 
    x="gdp_per_capita", 
    y="life_expectancy", 
    animation_frame="year", 
    color="continent",
    hover_name="country",
    size="population_millions",
    range_x=[100, 100000], 
    range_y=[20, 90]
)
fig.show()

                                                
Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
In this section, we explore the relationship between life expectancy and population across different countries and years.

import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px

df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

fig = px.scatter(
    df, 
    x="population_millions", 
    y="life_expectancy",
    animation_frame="year",
    color="continent",
    hover_name="country",
    size="gdp_per_capita",
    range_x=[0, 1500],
    range_y=[20, 90], 
    title="Life Expectancy vs. Population"

)

fig.show()

text:

fig.show()
